paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses a synonymous SNP in the TTR gene associated with decompression sickness resistance in rats, detailing its frequency in different populations and the expression levels of TTR mRNA.

patients.demographics: 5 males and 5 females from DCS-resistant and standard strains

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In DCS‐resistant strain (five males and five females), there are no thymine homozygous rats but there are three rats of each sex heterozygous thymine/cytosine and two rats of each sex homozygous with cytosine on position 138 from CDS.

functional_data.summary: The study indicates that TTR mRNA levels were lower in DCS-resistant rats compared to standard rats.

variants.segregation_data: The variant does not segregate with disease as all DCS-resistant rats are unaffected.
variants.population_frequency: Thymine allele present in 90% and 100% of standard males and females, respectively; 30% in DCS-resistant males and females.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on allele frequency and expression data.
variants.additional_notes: The study suggests a potential association between the SNP and lower TTR expression in DCS-resistant rats.
key_quotes: The frequency of thymine is 90% and 100% in standard males and females, respectively, whereas this allele is present in only 30% of resistant males and females.

tables_processed.table_caption: Frequencies of TTR coding sequence variant (444 bp) in standard and DCS‐resistant rats.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant was extracted from the main text and tables.
